column4: how can i find what my hard drive is called so i can access it? also how do i do access it b/c i havent done it in a while
sudo fdisk -l maybe what youre looking for
but its prob already mounted under /media/ directory
yes but it has grub on it so i cannot get to windows because of it
sudo fdisk -t to find partition name; then sudo mount -o umask=000 /dev/hda1 /whateverdirectory replace hda1 w/ whatever you see after typing fdisk -l
fdisk came up as /dev/hdb1 but when i typed that in the sudo mount it said it wasnt found in the /etc/fstab or /etc/mtab
type sudo mkdir /media/hdb1 then type sudo gedit /etc/fstab
add this line to fstab: /dev/hdb1       /media/hdb1      ntfs    umask=000,defaults        0       0
then save and quit gedit the type in terminal sudo mount -a'
then just make a directory then type sudo mount -o umask=000 /dev/hdb1 /directoryname
where do i place the directory?
just put it in your home directory
you cant really uninstall grub you need really to install whatever you want over it
